alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 2:38AM EST until January 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow and strong winds expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet in the most persistent lake snows, with local amounts of 2 to 3 feet possible where bands persist the longest. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph early in the event will diminish somewhat by Sunday morning. Blizzard conditions will be possible at times, especially tonight through Sunday. * WHERE...The Eastern Lake Ontario Region. Greatest snow amounts will be from the Tug Hill northward across Jefferson and northern Lewis counties. * WHEN...From 4 PM Saturday to 1 PM EST Monday. The band of heavy lake effect snow is expected to oscillate north and south several times through the course of the event, resulting in varying conditions over time. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible with deep snow cover on roads. Widespread blowing snow will reduce visibility to near zero in lake effect bands. Strong winds could cause tree and powerline damage.
info.instruction: Heavy snow will fall in relatively narrow bands and this combined with blowing snow will reduce visibility to near zero. Travel will be extremely difficult to impossible in heavy lake effect bands. Travel within lake effect bands will be extremely dangerous tonight and Sunday. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
